a.span: WDMCS schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year. Read the latest update on how COVID-19/Coronavirus is impacting our WDMCS community.

li.a: Events Canceled Due to Coronavirus Outbreak

div.p: CLICK IMAGE TO DOWNLOAD IN ARABIC, ENGLISH, HAKHA CHIN, SPANISH, SWAHILI, OR VIETNAMESE.

p.strong: This page is intended to be a source of information about COVID-19 and provide links to the most updated information on how it is impacting our West Des Moines Community Schools (WDMCS) community.

p.em: To stay up-to-date with COVID-19-related updates from WDMCS, watch this web pageÂ and download the free WDMCS app on your phone (Google PlayÂ orÂ App Store).

div.p: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by a new coronavirus. COVID-19 originated in Wuhan, Hubel Province, China. It is being closely monitored by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
The virus is thought to spread mainly from person-to-person.

ul.li: Between people who are in close contact with one another (within about 6 feet).
Through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes.

It may be possible that a person can get COVID-19 by touching a surface or object that has the virus on it and then touching their own mouth, nose, or possibly their eyes, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads.

p.a: Learn more about how COVID-19 Spreads

div.p: The following symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure.

ul.li: develop symptoms, and have been in close contact with a person known to have COVID-19
have recently traveled from an area with widespread or ongoing community spread of COVID-19.

div.h2: What You Can Do To Help

p.span: Families and community members can help by following these
simple, easy steps that help prevent the spread of ALL contagious viruses, including COVID-19.
Practice the same routine hygiene used to help prevent the c

div.p:
April 17, 2020
In a news conference Friday, April 17, Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds announced that Iowa K-12 public schools would be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Read the latest update >
